definition: Confucianism
scholar/Confucian
to learn/to study/to imitate/science/-ology

sentences.english: Great Master Yinguang, with huge accomplishment of Confucianism, is the 13th master of the Pure Land Sect.
sentences.chinese: 印光大师是具有丰厚儒学修养的净土宗十三代祖师。

sentences.english: Confucian academic legitimacy rebuilding under the influence of political reforms and academic changes.
sentences.chinese: 政局变革与学术变迁影响下的儒学正统性建构。

sentences.english: This article would like to discuss Mr. Tang Jun-yi's influence on Taiwanese Confucianism.
sentences.chinese: 本文旨在论述唐君毅先生对台湾儒学的影响。

sentences.english: The third part focuses on his practice of Confucian education.
sentences.chinese: 主要探讨了马一浮儒学教育思想的实践。

sentences.english: There are plentiful the rule of virtue thought in the Confucian tradition.
sentences.chinese: 儒学传统中有丰富的“德治”思想。

sentences.english: It is unclear what the revival of Confucianism entails for China.
sentences.chinese: 至今还不清楚儒学的复兴能为中国带来什么样的结局。

sentences.english: Of the lofty moral quality of Confucianism we have already spoken.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经谈过儒学高尚的道德属性。

sentences.english: He modeled himself on Mencius while he was criticizing heterodoxy and keeping Confucianism traditions.
sentences.chinese: 他以孟子为法，力辟异端，维护儒学传统。

sentences.english: Participants discussed the present and future “soft power” of Confucianism.
sentences.chinese: 与会者还探讨了儒学现在和未来的“软实力”。

sentences.english: Chinese Buddhism takes effect in Confucianism of song which is an indisputable fact.
sentences.chinese: 中国佛教对于宋明新儒学的影响是不争的事实。

sentences.english: Neo-Confucianism Neo-Confucianism continue to interpret within the framework of poetic mood.
sentences.chinese: 宋明理学继续在儒学的框架内解读诗意心境。

sentences.english: Solid scholarship is a trend of thought in the process of the development of Confucianism.
sentences.chinese: 实学是中国儒学发展过程中的一种思潮。

sentences.english: Greek philosopher, a prototype of the Cynics.
sentences.chinese: 希腊哲学家，犬儒学派奠基人之一。

sentences.english: Transcendent being theory is a significant part of Mou Zongsan's Confucianism thought.
sentences.chinese: 超越存有论是牟宗三儒学思想的标志性成果之一。

sentences.english: The cultural structure has also been transplanted into the Xixia culture.
sentences.chinese: 儒学的文化结构，也大都被移植到西夏文化之中。

sentences.english: In Wu's eyes, "Kindness" is the core concept of Confucianism, while according to the New Culture School;
sentences.chinese: 吴宓和新文化派产生分歧的另一个领域是儒学。

definition: study of the Confucian classics
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
Confucian thoughts/the thinking of the Confucian school
Confucianism
the teaching of Confucius and Mencius
Former Han dynasty school of Confucian scholars
Confucian
Confucius and Mencius
School of Mind/Neo-Confucian Idealistic School (from Song to mid-Qing times, c. 1000-1750, typified by the teachings of Wang Yangming 王陽明|王阳明[Wang2 Yang2 ming2])
Confucian study of ethics/study of Daoism/school for Daoism in Tang and Song times/Daoist magic/another name for 理學|理学, rational learning of Song dynasty neo-Confucianism

School of Principle/Neo-Confucian Rationalistic School (from Song to mid-Qing times, c. 1000-1750, typified by the teachings of Cheng Hao 程顥|程颢[Cheng2 Hao4], Cheng Yi 程頤|程颐[Cheng2 Yi2] and Zhu Xi 朱熹[Zhu1 xi1])
science
Western learning (intellectual movement in the late Qing)/also called 洋務運動|洋务运动
Dong Zhongshu (179-104 BC), philosopher influential in establishing Confucianism as the established system of values of former Han dynasty
sinology/Chinese studies (in foreign schools)/Han Learning, a Qing dynasty movement aiming at a philological appraisal of the Classics
historiography
New Confucianism, a social and political movement founded in 1920s China that combines aspects of Western and Eastern philosophy/see also 當代新儒家|当代新儒家[Dang1 dai4 Xin1 Ru2 jia1]
